Gets a list of representative sires and dams for an individual obtained by searching pedigree.

Source: R/getRepresentativeParents.R
getRepresentativeParents.Rd

Representative sires and dams are defined as animals are to have the following characteristics.

  1. Alive at the time of birthThis is okay for dams but weak for sires as sire could have died prior to birth. This should be strengthed with a gestational time estimate. A gestational time of 0 is currently used.

The function getRepresentativeParents is used to find representative parents within the pedigree that could have been the parent for an animal born within the pedigree that does not have one or more parents identified. These representative parents are then used to calculate an estimated kinship coefficient by averaging the kinship coefficient of the sires and of the dams.

getRepresentativeParents(id, ped)

Arguments

id

character vector of length 1 containing an animal ID from with the associated pedigree.

ped

datatable that is the `Pedigree`. It contains pedigree information. The id column is required.

Details

The current strategy is to use all representative parents as defined by the criteria above. This could be enhanced by allowing the user to provide a list of representative parents if available. This could be easily handled.

Contents

Developed by Michael Raboin, Terry Therneau, Amanda Vinson, R. Mark Sharp, Matthew Schultz, Southwest National Primate Research Center NIH grant P51 RR13986, Oregon National Primate Research Center grant P51 OD011092.
